programme.title: Woodshock, (2017, Drama)
programme.desc: A haunted young woman spirals into confusion and chaos after she falls under the spell of a potent, reality-altering drug.

programme.title: The Watchers, (2024, Horror)
programme.desc: A 28-year-old artist gets stranded in an expansive, untouched forest in western Ireland. Finding shelter, she unknowingly becomes trapped alongside three strangers who are stalked by mysterious creatures every night.

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: Bishop's most formidable foe kidnaps the love of his life in order to make him complete three impossible assassinations and make them look like accidents.

programme.title: Injustice, (2021, Animated)
programme.desc: On an alternate earth, the Joker tricks Superman into killing Lois Lane, sending Superman down a path of destruction.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: London publicist Edina Monsoon and best friend Patsy Stone flee to the French Riviera after accidentally knocking supermodel Kate Moss into the River Thames.

programme.title: The Bling Ring, (2013, Comedy)
programme.desc: A teenager (Israel Broussard) and his gang of fame-obsessed youths (Katie Chang, Taissa Farmiga) use the Internet to track the whereabouts of celebrities, then rob their homes.

programme.title: Hackers, (1995, Thriller)
programme.desc: A master hacker (Jonny Lee Miller) unites teen computer freaks against an embezzling computer-security agent known as the Plague.

programme.title: A Ghost Story, (2017, Drama)
programme.desc: A passionate young couple, unexpectedly separated by a shocking loss, discover an eternal connection and a love that is infinite.

programme.title: Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster, (1964, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Godzilla, Rodan and Mothra team up to save mankind from the deadliest threat of all -- a fire-breathing space monster.

programme.title: The Accountant, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: A Treasury agent (J.K. Simmons) closes in on a brilliant freelance accountant (Ben Affleck) who works for dangerous criminal organizations.

programme.title: For All Mankind, (1989, Documentary)
programme.desc: A unique view of the moon is made possible through film taken by the Apollo astronauts who landed on the surface.

programme.title: Tuesday, (2023, Drama)
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter must confront Death when it arrives in the form of an astonishing talking bird.

programme.title: Kicks, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: A 15-year-old (Jahking Guillory) recruits his two best friends (Christopher Meyer, Christopher Jordan Wallace) to help him retrieve his stolen Air Jordan sneakers from a neighborhood thug (Kofi Siriboe).

programme.title: Mortal Kombat Legends: Battle of the Realms, (2021, Animated)
programme.desc: The heroes must travel to Outworld to defend Earthrealm as Scorpion searches for the ancient Kamidogu before it's used to resurrect the One Being.

programme.title: The Roads Not Taken, (2020, Drama)
programme.desc: A man's journey through New York City takes on a hallucinatory quality as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, while his daughter wrestles with her own path as she considers her future.

programme.title: Mortal Kombat Legends: Cage Match, (2023, Animated)
programme.desc: Action superstar Johnny Cage squares off against a sinister secret society that's plotting a nefarious scheme. However, the brutal fight against the bloodthirsty warriors of the Netherrealm is just the beginning.

programme.title: Godzilla, King of the Monsters!, (1956, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A U.S. newsman (Raymond Burr) in Tokyo recounts the story of a huge dinosaur roused from the sea by an atomic blast.

programme.title: Traitor, (2008, Action)
programme.desc: Conflicting evidence leads a federal agent (Guy Pearce) to question the motives behind a former Special Ops soldier's (Don Cheadle) apparent ties to terrorist groups.

programme.title: Batman: The Doom That Came to Gotham, (2023, Animated)
programme.desc: Bruce Wayne returns to Gotham City and learns of a sinister doomsday cult planning its destruction. Bruce must don the mantle of Batman to fight against ancient magic foes and fiery demons while guarding his sanity against the Old Gods' corruption.

programme.title: The Daytrippers, (1996, Comedy)
programme.desc: Family members (Pat McNamara, Anne Meara) join a woman (Hope Davis) on an odyssey to confront her husband about a love letter addressed to him.

programme.title: Justice League: Warworld, (2023, Animated)
programme.desc: Kidnapped and transported to a strange world, Batman, Superman and Wonder Woman unite to form a resistance and lead the planet to freedom.

programme.title: It, (1990, Drama)
programme.desc: In 1960, seven preteen outcasts fight an evil demon that poses as a child-killing clown. Thirty years later, they reunite to stop the demon once and for all when it returns to their hometown.

programme.title: Notting Hill, (1999, Romance)
programme.desc: A man's (Hugh Grant) life changes when an international star (Julia Roberts) walks into his bookshop.

programme.title: Warcraft, (2016, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A king (Dominic Cooper), a mighty warrior (Travis Fimmel) and a powerful wizard (Ben Foster) unite to defend the human realm of Azeroth from a tyrannical shaman (Daniel Wu) and his invading army of orcs.

programme.title: Unknown, (2011, Thriller)
programme.desc: After a serious car accident, a man (Liam Neeson) awakes to find that his wife does not recognize him, that another man has assumed his identity, and that assassins are hunting him.

programme.title: The Bling Ring, (2013, Comedy)
programme.desc: A teenager (Israel Broussard) and his gang of fame-obsessed youths (Katie Chang, Taissa Farmiga) use the Internet to track the whereabouts of celebrities, then rob their homes.

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Hedorah, (1971, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Godzilla fights pollution in the form of living sludge found by a scientist (Akira Yamauchi) and his son (Toshie Kimura).

programme.title: Addicted, (2014, Drama)
programme.desc: A successful businesswoman (Sharon Leal) puts her family, career and life on the line to satisfy her addiction to sex.

programme.title: Barbie, (2023, Comedy)
programme.desc: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

programme.title: High Life, (2018, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Monte and his baby daughter are the last survivors of a damned and dangerous mission to the outer reaches of the solar system. They must now rely on each other to survive as they hurtle toward the oblivion of a black hole.

programme.title: A Cure for Wellness, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: After traveling to a remote location in the Swiss Alps, a Wall Street stockbroker (Dane DeHaan) unravels the terrifying secrets of a mysterious spa where guests never leave.

programme.title: Mississippi Masala, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: People resent the romance of a black man (Denzel Washington) and an Indian woman (Sarita Choudhury) in a Mississippi town.

programme.title: Superman/Batman: Public Enemies, (2009, Animated)
programme.desc: Superman (Tim Daly) and Batman join forces to save the world from Lex Luthor's (Clancy Brown) evil plot.

programme.title: Mortdecai, (2015, Comedy)
programme.desc: Armed with only his good looks and special charm, an art dealer (Johnny Depp) travels the world to find a stolen painting that is rumored to contain the code to a bank account filled with Nazi gold.

programme.title: Night on Earth, (1992, Drama)
programme.desc: Five brief encounters occur in five taxis on the same night in Los Angeles, New York, Rome, Paris and Helsinki.

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: An acclaimed neurologist (Jamie Dornan) taps into the unconscious mind of a 9-year-old boy (Aiden Longworth) who has survived nine near-death accidents.

programme.title: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me, (1992, Crime Story)
programme.desc: Agent Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) comes to Twin Peaks, Wash., following two unresolved murders and the disappearance of two fellow agents.

programme.title: My Cousin Rachel, (2017, Drama)
programme.desc: Philip is a young Englishman who falls under the spell of a beautiful but manipulative woman named Rachel. As his obsession for her grows, she hatches a scheme to win back her late husband's estate from the unsuspecting Philip.

programme.title: Accidentally Brave
programme.desc: With unexpected humor, Maddie Corman shares a story of perseverance and hope in the face of crisis.

programme.title: Anomalisa, (2015, Animated)
programme.desc: An inspirational speaker (David Thewlis) becomes reinvigorated after meeting a lively woman (Jennifer Jason Leigh) who shakes up his mundane existence.

programme.title: Diablo, (2015, Western)
programme.desc: A young Civil War veteran (Scott Eastwood) embarks on a quest to save his kidnapped wife (Camilla Belle) from a band of ruthless Mexican bandits.

programme.title: 1900, (1976, Drama)
programme.desc: The son (Robert De Niro) of a landowner and the son (G√©rard Depardieu) of a peasant become enemies in 20th-century Italy.

programme.title: The Krays, (1990, Crime Story)
programme.desc: Warped by their mother (Billie Whitelaw), cockney twins Ronald and Reginald Kray (Gary Kemp, Martin Kemp) become gangsters in 1950s London.

programme.title: Intersection, (1994, Drama)
programme.desc: An architect (Richard Gere) on the brink of a car accident recalls troubles with his wife (Sharon Stone) and his mistress (Lolita Davidovich) in Vancouver, British Columbia.

programme.title: Blink Twice, (2024, Thriller)
programme.desc: When tech billionaire Slater King meets Frida, he invites her to join him and his friends for a dream vacation on his private island. However, when strange things start to happen, she'll have to uncover the truth if she hopes to make it out alive.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: As Tim's investigation pays off in ways he never imagined and Sigsby scrambles to avert disaster, Luke must finally decide who he can trust.

programme.title: A Working Man, (2025, Action)
programme.desc: Levon Cade left behind a military career in the black ops to live a simple life. However, when human traffickers kidnap his boss's daughter, his search to bring her home uncovers a world of corruption far greater than he ever could have imagined.

programme.title: Training Day, (2001, Thriller)
programme.desc: A rookie police officer meets a corrupt Los Angeles narcotics detective who wants to include him in his schemes.

programme.title: Shutter Island, (2010, Thriller)
programme.desc: A 1950s lawman (Leonardo DiCaprio) pursues a murderess who appears to have vanished from a locked room within a fortresslike psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: As Tim's investigation pays off in ways he never imagined and Sigsby scrambles to avert disaster, Luke must finally decide who he can trust.

programme.title: Mr. & Mrs. Bridge, (1990, Drama)
programme.desc: A rich Midwestern lawyer (Paul Newman), his wife (Joanne Woodward) and their children grow apart in the World War II era.

programme.title: Jason's Lyric, (1994, Drama)
programme.desc: A TV salesman falls for a spirited waitress and clashes with his wayward brother, as their lives reconnect in inner-city Houston.

programme.title: The Portable Door, (2023, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A man lands an internship at a mysterious London firm with unconventional employees, including the charismatic CEO who is incorporating modern corporate strategy into ancient magical practices.

programme.title: Madea's Witness Protection, (2012, Comedy)
programme.desc: Placed under federal protection in Madea's Southern home, a Wall Street banker and his dysfunctional family get a taste of the no-nonsense matriarch's special brand of tough love.

programme.title: Nobody's Fool, (2018, Romance)
programme.desc: Wild child Tanya looks to her buttoned-up, by-the-book sister Danica to help her get back on her feet. As these polar opposites collide, Tanya soon discovers that Danica's picture-perfect life and boyfriend may not be what they seem.

programme.title: Down to Earth, (2001, Comedy)
programme.desc: Accidentally sent to Heaven, a comic (Chris Rock) returns to Earth in the body of a Manhattan mogul whose family is plotting to kill him.

programme.title: Barbershop: The Next Cut, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: With the barbershop now coed, Calvin (Ice Cube), Eddie (Cedric the Entertainer) and the rest of the gang come up with a plan to save the neighborhood from crime.

programme.title: Clue, (1985, Mystery)
programme.desc: Col. Mustard, Miss Scarlet, Mrs. Peacock, and company solve a mansion murder based on the board game.

programme.title: Team America: World Police, (2004, Comedy)
programme.desc: Puppet commandos protect the planet from fiendish terrorists and North Korean dictator Kim Jong Il (Trey Parker).

programme.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!, (1988, Comedy)
programme.desc: A blundering Los Angeles detective (Leslie Nielsen) and his boss (George Kennedy) foil a plan to assassinate Queen Elizabeth.

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: Frank (Leslie Nielsen) and Ed (George Kennedy) of "Police Squad" blunder through another case, an energy-related plot in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Jackass: The Movie, (2002, Comedy)
programme.desc: Nitwits (Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Chris Pontius) perform outrageous stunts and pull practical jokes on an unsuspecting public.

programme.title: Jackass: Number Two, (2006, Comedy)
programme.desc: Daredevils go for the gross-out when they subject an unsuspecting public to more outrageous stunts and practical jokes.

programme.title: Jackass 3, (2010, Comedy)
programme.desc: Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Steve-O and their fearless and foolhardy friends perform outrageous pranks and stunts, including "Sweatsuit Cocktail" and "Beehive Tetherball.".

programme.title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa, (2013, Comedy)
programme.desc: Irving Zisman (Johnny Knoxville) takes his young and impressionable grandson (Jackson Nicoll) on a cross-country trip in which they encounter male strippers, biker-bar patrons and other unsuspecting citizens.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Sigsby tricks Luke into confirming he's TP, forcing him to move up his escape attempt; Tim's suspicions put him on the Institute's radar.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: As Tim's investigation pays off in ways he never imagined and Sigsby scrambles to avert disaster, Luke must finally decide who he can trust.

programme.title: Beauty Shop, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: After a falling-out with an overbearing employer, reputed hairstylist Gina decides to go independent. Soon enough, she opens the doors of her new salon to an amusing crowd of patrons.

programme.title: The Cutting Edge, (1992, Romance)
programme.desc: An ex-hockey player (D.B. Sweeney) and a prima donna (Moira Kelly) bicker as paired figure skaters shooting for the Olympics.

programme.title: Agent Cody Banks, (2003, Children)
programme.desc: Recruited by the CIA, a teen works under cover to befriend a girl whose father unknowingly works for an evil organization.

programme.title: Desperately Seeking Susan, (1985, Comedy)
programme.desc: A bored housewife (Rosanna Arquette) with amnesia thinks she is "Susan," a wild woman (Madonna) on the run.

programme.title: Sabrina, (1995, Romance)
programme.desc: Sons (Harrison Ford, Greg Kinnear) of a Long Island tycoon become romantic rivals for the chauffeur's daughter (Julia Ormond).

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral, (1994, Romance)
programme.desc: An English charmer (Hugh Grant) and a lusty American (Andie MacDowell) make love over a course of surprising events.

programme.title: Moonstruck, (1987, Romance)
programme.desc: An Italian-American widow (Cher), engaged to a reticent suitor, falls in love with his brother (Nicolas Cage).

programme.title: Legally Blonde, (2001, Comedy)
programme.desc: A sorority queen (Reese Witherspoon) enrolls in Harvard to prove to her former boyfriend that she has more than good looks.

programme.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde, (2003, Comedy)
programme.desc: Fired from her firm, a young Boston lawyer (Reese Witherspoon) heads to Washington, D.C., to fight for animal rights.

programme.title: Serendipity, (2001, Romance)
programme.desc: A man (John Cusack) and a woman (Kate Beckinsale) try to find each other after spending one night together 10 years earlier.

programme.title: Mean Girls, (2024, Musical)
programme.desc: A new student gets welcomed into the top of the social food chain by an elite group of popular girls called the Plastics. However, when she makes the misstep of falling for the queen bee's ex-boyfriend, she finds herself caught in their crosshairs.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: As Tim's investigation pays off in ways he never imagined and Sigsby scrambles to avert disaster, Luke must finally decide who he can trust.

programme.title: Three Thousand Years of Longing, (2022, Fantasy)
programme.desc: While attending a conference in Istanbul, Dr. Alithea Binnie happens to encounter a djinn who offers her three wishes in exchange for his freedom. Eventually, she's beguiled and makes a wish that surprises them both.

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: A money launderer (Stellan Skarsgard) for Russian gangsters asks a couple vacationing in Marrakech, Morocco, to deliver incriminating evidence to an MI6 agent (Damian Lewis).

programme.title: The Portable Door, (2023, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A man lands an internship at a mysterious London firm with unconventional employees, including the charismatic CEO who is incorporating modern corporate strategy into ancient magical practices.

programme.title: The Living Daylights, (1987, Action)
programme.desc: Secret agent James Bond (Timothy Dalton) takes a Czech cellist (Maryam d'Abo) to her boyfriend, a KGB defector (Jeroen Krabb√©) doing business in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Dr. No, (1962, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Sean Connery) foils a SPECTRE madman (Joseph Wiseman) out to divert rockets from Cape Canaveral.

programme.title: Octopussy, (1983, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) links a fake Faberge egg to smugglers (Maud Adams, Louis Jourdan) in league with a mad Soviet general.

programme.title: From Russia With Love, (1963, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 arrives in Istanbul, bringing with him a Russian beauty who is an unwitting pawn in SPECTRE's plot to kill him.

programme.title: Live and Let Die, (1973, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) charms a tarot reader (Jane Seymour) in Jamaica on the voodoo/heroin trail of Mr. Big (Yaphet Kotto).

programme.title: GoldenEye, (1995, Action)
programme.desc: A secret weapon's theft sends Agent 007 to Russia, where a pretty computer programmer helps him track an ex-cohort believed dead.

programme.title: Casino Royale, (2006, Action)
programme.desc: After receiving a license to kill, British agent James Bond (Daniel Craig) enters a high-stakes poker game with Le Chiffre (Mads Mikkelsen), a man who finances terrorist groups.

programme.title: Die Another Day, (2002, Action)
programme.desc: James Bond (Pierce Brosnan) teams with a beautiful agent (Halle Berry) to battle a terrorist and a businessman (Toby Stephens) bent on world domination.

programme.title: Marathon Man, (1976, Thriller)
programme.desc: The CIA and a Nazi death-camp dentist (Laurence Olivier) chase a New York graduate student (Dustin Hoffman).

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's friends are unconscious, leaving him to defeat Alexander the Great on his own!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Grandpa found the Millennium Puzzle decades ago, but little is known about the terrors, traps, turmoil, and treachery he faced to find the ancient artifact! See how it all began as we learn how Grandpa unearthed the Millennium Puzzle.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The evil spirit within the Millennium Ring has reunited with Bakura, prepped with a new monster to create the ultimate Shadow Game. And his first target is Kaiba!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The past is quickly becoming perilous as the fearless bandit king Bakura has invaded the Pharaoh's palace to take down the keepers of the seven Millennium Items single-handedly!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Even with the potent power of Obelisk the Tormentor, the Pharaoh couldn't prevent the bandit Bakura from escaping. Everyone knows that thief will return for a rematch, so Seto has a plan to create a powerful army.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Mahad vows to stop the bandit king Bakura's sneak attacks once and for all, but he may have made a promise he can't keep!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Mahad, the first of the Pharaoh's guardians, has fallen. Even worse, the bandit king Bakura now has the Millennium Ring, making his Diabound even more unstoppable!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The origins of the Millennium Items are revealed! Who forged these powerful artifacts, and why were they created? Though the Millennium Items are powerful, such power comes with a heavy price... a debt that may never be able to be repaid!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Pharaoh calls forth the mighty Egyptian God Slifer the Sky Dragon to fight the bandit Bakura's Diabound, but when Diabound starts attacking the townspeople, the Pharaoh must protect them, even if it means sacrificing himself!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The bandit Bakura has stolen the Millennium Puzzle and sent the Pharaoh plummeting into the abyss. Now he's another step closer to obtaining all seven Millennium Items and resurrecting the malevolent Zorc, the greatest evil of all time!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and the Pharaoh are reunited, but the Pharaoh is powerless without the Millennium Puzzle! However, that won't stop the Pharaoh from a final showdown against the bandit king Bakura.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: It's the showdown in the sands between the bandit Bakura and his ever-growing Diabound versus the Pharaoh, Mahad the Dark Magician, and the remaining guardians of the Pharaoh!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: With the help of his father's spirit, the Pharaoh and his guardians defeated the bandit Bakura's Diabound and stopped the horrible Zorc from resurrecting... or did they?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Zorc's incredible shadow energies have resurrected the bandit Bakura and his Diabound. With a second chance at revenge, the bandit king has broken up the Pharaoh's team so that he can divide and conquer them one at a time!

programme.desc: After a nearly eternal slumber, the all-powerful Zorc has resurrected, plunging the world into darkness!
programme.sub-title: The Dark One Cometh: Part I

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Pharaoh and his guardians are down to their last line of defense as Shada falls victim to Zorc. The Pharaoh desperately wants to summon the three Egyptian Gods, but he can't without his Millennium Puzzle!
programme.sub-title: The Dark One Cometh: Part II

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Exodia the Forbidden One couldn't defeat Zorc! Exodia was able to buy enough time for the Pharaoh to get his Millennium Puzzle back-he can now summon the almighty Egyptian Gods! It's time for the Pharaoh's counterattack in the biggest brawl.
programme.sub-title: The Dark One Cometh: Part III

programme.desc: The three Egyptian Gods have been defeated. The Pharaoh is severely hurt and unable to stop Zorc from setting fire to the city, but our heroes aren't giving up. It's not double vision when Seto and Kaiba transcend time to confront Zorc.
programme.sub-title: The Dark One Cometh: Part IV

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Pharaoh and Kaiba's combined strength couldn't defeat Zorc. Yugi must give the Pharaoh his name, but Yugi doesn't know how to read ancient Egyptian text. All bets are off in the final clash where Yugi must protect the past to save the future!
programme.sub-title: In the Name of the Pharaoh

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!

programme.desc: Yugi and Atem - more than friends, closer than brothers. Will they stay together, or is it time to say goodbye? It's the final answer, the final duel, and the final time we will see our friends in the rousing conclusion to Yu-Gi-Oh!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi is forced to face Duel Monsters creator, Maximillion Pegasus, in the mysterious Shadow Realm where all the monsters and magic are real. If Yugi loses, Pegasus claims Grandpa's soul as his prize!

programme.desc: Yugi gives up one of his own Star Chips so Joey can board the boat bound for Duelist Kingdom and duel to save his sister's eyesight. Meanwhile, the cheat Weevil tries to cripple Yugi's deck by tossing his best cards overboard!

programme.title: Brook hears Big Mom's plan firsthand as she shares her intentions with Pudding in front of him! Meanwhile, Big Mom's agents believe most of the Straw Hats to be under control, but doubt besets Montd'Or.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Deciding to Say Goodbye! Sanji and his Straw-Hat Bento!

programme.title: Nami and the others finally find Brook in the mirror dimension - but he's in the most inopportune of places! Can they challenge the sleeping Mama and rescue their friend? Meanwhile, Luffy is waylaid on his way back to the rendezvous!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Emperor Rolls Over! Rescue Brook Mission!

programme.title: Luffy puts up a valiant fight in order to keep his word to Sanji! But will he be able to last until Sanji arrives at the rendezvous? Meanwhile, Jimbei shares the awful truth about the wedding with the other Straw Hats.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Rendezvous! Luffy, a One-on-One at His Limit!

programme.title: Sanji and Luffy meet finally - and while he is happy to feed Luffy to replenish his energy, Sanji's explanation of what actions he must take baffles Luffy! The crucial decision, to turn his back on his friends or his family, tears Sanji apart!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: The newly reunited Luffy and Sanji hear from the rest of the Straw Hats in the mirror dimension! Then, Jimbei starts telling them about Capone "Gang" Bege and proposes a shocking plan to take down Big Mom!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sanji Comes Back! Crash! The Tea Party from Hell!

programme.title: The Straw Hats put Jimbei's plan into action and approach Bege with the possibility of an alliance. But before they are granted an audience, they must make themselves presentable!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Secret Meeting! Luffy vs. the Fire Tank Pirates!

programme.title: The proposed alliance between the Straw Hats and Bege unfolds! A gaseous blast from the past, Gastino, a member of Bege's team, reveals the secret weapon that the team plans to use against the Emperor!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Deadly Pact! Luffy & Bege's Allied Forces!

programme.title: Now, the assassination plan of Big Mom is all set and everyone starts preparing for the Tea Party. Montd'Or finds one of his crewmates, Bobbin the Disposer, dead, and suspects Sanji and Luffy of the crime.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Luffy Engages in a Secret Maneuver! The Wedding Full of Conspiracies Starts Soon!

programme.title: The day has arrived! Guests from the criminal underground pour in droves, but some have their own agendas to settle! Big Mom's sons, however, stand in their way and show them what they've got! Meanwhile, Luffy is preparing for his own plan!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Family Gets Together! The Hellish Tea Party Starts!

programme.title: Final preparations abound on all sides and multiple plots start to come together! But can Sanji keep his nerve and go through with the plan? Or will Pudding's beauty prove too enchanting?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Broken Couple! Sanji and Pudding Enter!

programme.title: All plans go into action as the moment of the wedding arrives - but as the veil is lifted on Pudding's grotesque face, all hell breaks loose and unexpected circumstances mean chaos at the altar! Meanwhile, Luffy charges in, adding to the mayhem!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Deadly Kiss! The Mission to Assassinate the Emperor Kicks Off!

programme.title: The plan is launched! Big Mom falls to pieces as the wedding - and the wedding cake - are destroyed and a slew of Luffys are wreaking havoc around the site. But just when Luffy gets in trouble, Jimbei confronts Big Mom bravely!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Returning the Sake Cup! The Manly Jimbei Pays His Debt!

programme.title: The plan is in full swing however - Big Mom is pushed past the edge of sanity and can't even bring herself to act. Meanwhile, her children make a move against Germa and Pudding takes up her original aim of killing Sanji!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Mission Failed?! The Big Mom Pirates Strike Back!

programme.title: The plot is in full swing as Luffy dashes towards Big Mom to show her the broken portrait again! Sanji makes an effort to free his family and wins the respect of his sister, and Big Mom loses her wits!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: The tragic and sad history of Big Mom is revealed! From abandonment, rescue, and again to ruin, Big Mom's voracious hunger has brought her into conflict with others from the very beginning!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Mom's Secret! The Giant's Island Elbaph and a Little Monster!

programme.title: Linlin enrages the Giants as she slays their respected warrior - but Mother throws herself on their mercy and begs for clemency for her beloved Linlin, forcing the troupe to leave Elbaph for good.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Birth of Mom! The Day That Carmel Vanished!

programme.title: Linlin, destroyed at the disappearance of Mother, falls in with a new cohort and finds a reason to go on living, proving herself a mighty force to be reckoned with! The Straw Hats' plan goes awry, and all hope looks to be lost!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Launcher Blasts! The Moment of Big Mom's Assassination!

programme.title: Bege and the Straw Hats are on the defensive as the full force of Mom's troops are brought down on them! As they retreat into a fortress, Germa 66 springs in to action! However, Bege has bad news for his allied forces.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: The Straw Hats and Germa 66 are cornered in Bege's stronghold - with the full force of the Big Mom Pirates pinning them down, it's only a matter of time before their defenses crack. The only way out seems to be to make a break for it.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Cutting the Father-Son Relationship! Sanji and Judge!

programme.title: The plan is executed to sneak the Straw Hats out of Big Mom's castle while hidden inside Bege! But the irascible Luffy can't resist getting in at least one punch against his foe! Meanwhile, the Tamate Box slips into the hands of some surprising agent!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Escape From the Tea Party! Luffy vs. Big Mom!

programme.title: The full might of the Big Mom Pirates proves too much for the Straw Hats and Germa 66. With no other options, they decide to turn and fight, even though it means their total annihilation!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Execution Begins! Luffy's Allied Forces Are Annihilated?!

programme.title: The Whole Cake Chateau starts crumbling while everyone is trying to escape for their lives! Luffy and the others get away and move on to the next stage of their escape, which involves some parting of ways.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Castle Collapses! The Straw Hat‚Äôs Great Escape Begins!

programme.title: The Straw Hats continue their mad dash to the Sunny! As Big Mom rages, her underlings decide to turn her Hunger Pang attacks against the Straw Hats! The Whole Cake Island scrambles to remake the cake to calm down Big Mom!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Spear of Elbaph! Onslaught! The Flying Big Mom!

programme.title: Kingbaum puts his life on the line ferrying the Straw Hats towards the Seducing Woods! But Big Mom's word trumps him in this terrifying forest, and soon enough she catches up! Meanwhile, Pudding puts her plan to rebuild the cake into action!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Pudding's Determination! Ablaze! The Seducing Woods!

programme.title: Zeus pursues the Straw Hats as Nami keeps him occupied. She has a shocking surprise in store for him, however, that might stop Big Mom in her tracks! Meanwhile, Brook and Chopper find the Shark Submerge in a strange situation.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Lightning Counterattack! Nami and Zeus the Thundercloud!

programme.title: Big Mom is relentless in her pursuit of the Straw Hats! Even being buried alive doesn't stop her! The plan to recreate the cake to stop her onslaught progresses, and Pudding's changeable heart confuses all those looking on!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Coincidental Reunion! Sanji and the Lovestruck Evil Pudding!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The ICPO tries a different approach to capturing Lupin: Astrology. It enlists the help of Marianne, a clairvoyant who can read Lupin's actions using astrological predictions and her crystal ball.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko calls Lupin from Professor Pot's lab, but since Lupin is half-asleep, Jigen takes the call instead. Fujiko claims Professor Pot has accidentally invented a robot that manufactures diamonds, but Jigen doesn't believe a word she says and hangs up.
programme.sub-title: Diamon's Shining in the Robot's Eye

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko has invited Lupin and company to a classical concert conducted by Kyoransky from the International Philharmonic. After they get a good look at Kyoransky's baton, studded with a a diamond worth at least 200 million yen.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin goes to prison intent on making Silver tell what he did with the loot, only to discover that a new top-of-the-line prison was built over the site where he hid the money. Will the operation to trade an execution for the recovery of the money succeed?
programme.sub-title: The Last Gift in Prison is Cup Ramen

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is after the Golden Bell, symbol of the monarchy of Beltenberg and precious tourist attraction. However, the bell that sparkles in the belfry is just a brass replica.
programme.sub-title: Fujiko, Men are A Sorry Lot!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Zenigata is taken hostage from ICPO headquarters. The terrorists demand to swap him with their boss Napoleon XI, but ICPO refuses. Since Zenigata is no further use to them, the terrorists are bound to kill him; but Lupin is to the rescue?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Smith Gang hit-man company was once the best in the business, but they're suffering now from tough competition. Though the company chairman Smith considers running TV ads to revive his business, he can't think of a good way to do it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Though Joe Spade was once a formidable hitman of renown and Jigen's sharpshooter coach, he now comes to beg for Jigen's help; he had gotten old, flubbed a hit contract, and is now on the run.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: ICPO Bureau Chief Jasmine is an able commissioner. She uses the governor to spur Zenigata into action, as she has a secret plan to arrest Lupin. But Jasmine's plan is to make this mission her very last at ICPO so she could get married.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Nightlight Mask murdered the Duke of Le Mond and stole his diamonds. ICPO is having trouble solving the case, so they induct mystery author Conan Dorill as a special inspector. Dorill deduces that the true identity of Nightlight Mask is Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: On a night of thunder and rain, a man gives Lupin a doll. The next day there is a news report that a diamond called the Phoenix's Tear had been stolen. Lupin's been caught on security cameras, but he has no recollection of having done the deed.
programme.sub-title: When the Devil Calls to Lupin

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin's target is the Vatican Crown, located at the North Pole. He devises a plan to thwart pesky Fujiko, which is to relocate penguins at the South Pole to the North Pole.
programme.sub-title: Lupin's North Pole, South Pole Adventures

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The World Crime Prevention Devices Association has developed the "killer safe" that sent many safe crackers to their graves. But Lupin takes the challenge to steal what it guards.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin crashes crime boss Markane's masquerade party, but the party was just a ruse to entrap Lupin. Lupin gets hung by rope in the dark and is made the target of Markane's murder game in ten rounds, of which players have to hit the target.
programme.sub-title: The Badder A Guy, The More Villainous He Is

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin gets called out to New York where he rescues a girl hunted by an organization called Red Spider. Lupin does everything he can to help the poor girl suffering from amnesia; he tries hypnosis on her but to no avail, he gets hypnotized instead.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Old man Piccolo had taught Lupin the art of thievery 15 years ago. Learning that his widowed wife had all of her belongings impounded by the police, Lupin promises her to get them all back.
programme.sub-title: The Merry Widow and the Robber's Quartette

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and crew sneak into Peking's Imperial Palace Museum to steal Emperor Shi's jade Mahjong set, but winds up getting chased by a gang.
programme.sub-title: Operation INVADER at the Great Wall of China

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Look who is flying above New York; it's Superman! All he does is fly around, but the town is in a panic because of his performance. In the meantime, a lot of banks get robbed.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin steals a statue called the Stone Child from the Metropolitan Art Museum; he and Fujiko make their getaway in a Cessna, but they crash at the Bermuda Triangle. They encounter a ghost ship at this grave of many ships and planes.
programme.sub-title: From the Ghost Ship with Love

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Foodie and gourmet aficionado Baron Gourmel says he wants to eat Lupin's brain. He claims he'd offer his own 70-million dollar jewelry collection to anyone who could capture Lupin. Fujiko hears of it and informs Lupin right away.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin III learns that his grandfather Ars√®ne Lupin's secret treasures are buried in his grave. Lupin learns of its location with Fujiko's microfilm.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen are surrounded, as usual, as they are trying to escape after a jewelry theft. But somebody shoots at Zenigata and hits him dead on. Lupin learns of the even the next morning in the papers, and Fujiko and Goemon get implicated.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The prime minister of the Duchy of Blanco has a one-of-a-kind gold coin of Hannibal hidden in his chest; well, Lupin and crew are after it. Amidst their scheming, Jigen is challenged to a duel with a man named Stoneman.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The prime minister of France has run up a ridiculous tab with Maxim of Paris, and orders the Louvre Museum proprietor to sell a painting to cover his bill. But the proprietor doesn't want to let it go, and takes the painting out of the museum.
programme.sub-title: The Ultra Operation in the Train

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin recieves a letter about Marie Antoinette's jeweled crown, and sneaks into the palace of Versailles. A young man called Oscar appears, the sender of the letter.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin was told by Fujiko to steal a pistol of the Wilhem family worth 500 million pounds. Meanwhile, a man named Jim Benkei, a giant of a man who's stirred troubled in London, steals Jigen's favorite Magnum ...

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is after the various jewels at the World Fair in Los Angeles. Lupin learns from Fujiko that a man named Harry Satler is also after the jewels, so he decides to go see who this guy is. The man he meets is a wizened old man‚Ä¶
programme.sub-title: The Wolf Looked at an Angel!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Pestered by Fujiko, Lupin has to steal a golden bed that was originally made by Louis XIV for Josephine. He makes a plan with Jigen and Goemon, but the owner of the bed, Morgan, is a formidable opponent who has WWII military experience.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Heike Clan and Minamoto Clan once battled on Devil's Head Island at the inland sea of Seto; Fujiko and Lupin go there to find out about the details behind the legend of the battle.
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of Demon's Head Island

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Vivian dreams of becoming a star some day, but her auditions are a bust. She thinks of using Lupin to become famous; she makes Lupin engage in thievery, and informs reporters to be at the site to catch him in the act.
programme.sub-title: A Cat for You! Dried Bonito for Me!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Louis XIV and Marie Antoinette's Hope Diamond has brought much misfortune on its possessors. The diamond is now safeguarded by a maximum security device. Fujiko provokes Lupin to steal that diamond.
programme.sub-title: The Wedding Ring is a Cursed Trap

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and crew go to a hot spring. Lupin and Jigen relax while Goemon trains at the cliffs. A girl manifests to Goemon and captures Goemon's heart. However, the girl is seeking the secret of his sword, for her swordsmith grandfather‚Ä¶

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has to battle a hitman called Tiger. Lupin tries to dodge him, but Tiger is one step ahead of him. Lupin keeps trying to escape him but Tiger is relentless; he has a way of disappearing and appearing at will.

programme.title: Hansel and Gretel: Witch Hunters, (2013, Action)
programme.desc: Get ready for a twisted take on the classic tale as Hansel and Gretel have turned pro, coping with the trauma of their childhood captivity by slaying witches for hire.

programme.title: Total Recall, (1990, Thriller)
programme.desc: It's 2084 A.D. and Doug Quaid is haunted by recurring dreams about journeying to Earths closest planetary neighbor, Mars.

programme.title: Attack the Block, (2011, Science fiction)
programme.desc: ATTACK THE BLOCK is a fast, funny, frightening action adventure movie that pits a teen street gang against an invasion of savage alien monsters. It turns a crazy mix of tough street kids into a team of kick ass heroes.

programme.title: Johnny Mnemonic, (1995, Action)
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves is a space-age courier who's plugged in, turned on and buffed up to deliver the most important data of the 21st century, wet-wired directly into his brain! A rapid-fire roller coaster of action and high-impact imagery! Rating: R

programme.title: Hansel and Gretel: Witch Hunters, (2013, Action)
programme.desc: Get ready for a twisted take on the classic tale as Hansel and Gretel have turned pro, coping with the trauma of their childhood captivity by slaying witches for hire.

programme.title: Total Recall, (1990, Thriller)
programme.desc: It's 2084 A.D. and Doug Quaid is haunted by recurring dreams about journeying to Earths closest planetary neighbor, Mars.

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day, (1991, Action)
programme.desc: The non-human machine ruling elite of the nuclear war-torn future has dispatched a cyborg assassin into the past to kill a young boy because he soon will be the resistance leader against the machines.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys, (2015, Action)
programme.desc: When John Connor sends Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect a young Sarah Connor, unexpected events alter the past and threaten the future for all mankind. Charged with a new mission, Reese must join forces with Sarah and her "Guardian" to save the world.

programme.title: Guns of The Magnificent Seven, (1969, Drama)
programme.desc: In this thrilling follow-up to one of the greatest Western sagas in film history, notorious desperado Chris Adams (George Kennedy) is offered a huge reward to free a young Mexican revolutionary from prison‚Ä¶in the midst of the Mexican Revolution.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride!, (1972, Drama)
programme.desc: When his wife is killed, Marshal Chris Adams (Lee Van Cleef) discovers that a ruthless horde of marauders has killed all the men -- and will come back for the women -- in a nearby border town...unless The Magnificent Seven can stop them!

programme.title: A Fistful Of Dynamite, (1972, Drama)
programme.desc: The results are explosive when an Irish terrorist (James Coburn) with a dynamite obsession teams up with a Mexican peasant-turned-revolutionary (Rod Steiger) in this action-packed tale of power and politics. Directed by the legendary Sergio Leone.

programme.title: Man of the West, (1958, Drama)
programme.desc: Screen legend Gary Cooper demonstrates why he will always be remembered as one of the most authentic stars of the screen. Capable yet vulnerable, Cooper's portrayal of a former outlaw whose past returns to haunt him ranks among his very best.

programme.title: Cast A Long Shadow, (1959, Drama)
programme.desc: Audie Murphy plays Matt, a troubled saddle tramp with a penchant for drinking. When he inherits a massive ranch, it leads him back into the arms of an old flame (Terry Moore), as well as into the fists some old rivals who would rather see him dead.

programme.title: The Misfits, (1961, Drama)
programme.desc: In their final screen performances, Clark Gable and Marilyn Monroe are at their luminous best as an aging cowboy and a disillusioned divorcee, each trying to adapt to new ways of life in John Huston's piercing classic. Montgomery Clift also stars.

programme.title: Hud, (1963, Drama)
programme.desc: Hud Bannon (Paul Newman) is the rebellious son of a respectable rancher who‚Äôs continually at odds with his aging father. Patricia Neal and Melvyn Douglas co-star, in their Oscar¬Æ-winning roles.

programme.title: Buffalo Bill and the Indians, (1976, Drama)
programme.desc: Buffalo Bill has fought Indians & Civil War battles, but nothing can prepare him for show business! When he signs Sitting Bull for a role in his Wild West Show, the clash of cultures reverberates far beyond the boundaries of their sprawling theater.

programme.title: Mean Girls, (2004, Comedy)
programme.desc: Cady thinks she understands "survival of the fittest." However, the law of the wild takes a whole new meaning when the homeschooled 15-year-old enters public high school for the first time.

programme.title: Dreamgirls, (2006, Musical)
programme.desc: With showstopping performances by a star-studded cast, Dreamgirls soars with the amazing story of three female singers who learn that anything is possible when you hold on to your dreams.

programme.title: Just Like Heaven, (2005, Romance)
programme.desc: He's convinced she's a spirit. She's convinced she's still alive. As they search for the truth of Elizabeth's past, their relationship changes from resentment to romance.

programme.desc: Ben Stiller, Jack Black and Robert Downey Jr. lead an ensemble cast in 'Tropic Thunder,' an action comedy about a group of self-absorbed actors who set out to make the most expensive war film.

programme.desc: Jack Black is more hilarious than ever as Ignacio, a monastery cook who feeds orphan children by day and by night transforms himself into Nacho Libre, a notorious Luchador in stretchy pants.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa falls into a coma. Usagi and the others are at a loss, when a Sailor Guardian calling herself Sailor Pluto suddenly appears before them.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The Black Moon clan sends down its next operative, Esmeraude, to open the Dark Gate in 20th century Tokyo.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi is still depressed over Mamoru calling off their relationship. Ami and Mako try to cheer her up by taking Usagi to a promise ring workshop.
programme.sub-title: Shared Feelings: Usagi and Mamoru in Love Once Again

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: A strange new flu is causing everyone to get sick, including the Sailor Guardians. Minako takes it upon herself to look after her sick friends.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Artemis is out to prove he is capable after being teased by Luna. He encounters a suspicious-looking man who is gathering stray animals.
programme.sub-title: Artemis's Adventure: The Monster Animal Kingdom

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The school test results are posted, and Ami is at the top of her class. She finds herself becoming isolated after rumors that she cheated on the test.
programme.sub-title: The Terrifying Illusion: Ami All Alone

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: After being out sick, Chibi-Usa returns to school eager to see her friends. But to her surprise, her friends and teachers begin attacking her.
programme.sub-title: The Dark Gate Is Completed? The Targeted Elementary School
